Washington DC washingtondc.jpg October 14, 2016 9:30:00 AM EST 38.895112 -77.036366 Coming soon! Join us for a LocationTech project design sprint and hackathon.
Athens, GA athens.jpg October 3, 2016 5:30:00 PM EST 33.9441952 -83.5292074 http://www.geospatialconferencega.com/registration-2 Georgia URISA and GITA Southeast are joining together again for the Georgia Geospatial Conference of 2016 to be held October 3rd-5th at the Classic Center in downtown Athens. Participants are welcome from federal, state, local governments; academic; private sector; non-profit and international organizations.

Victoria victoria.jpg January 25, 2016 09:00:00 AM PST 48.4222 -123.3657 https://www.locationtech.org/content/locationtech-incubation-sprint-victoria A sprint to focus on locationtech incubation requirements with GeoGig, GeoMesa, GeoTrellis, JTS Topology Suite and uDig projects participating.
San Francisco sanfrancisco.jpg December 10, 2015 06:30:00 PM PST 37.7833 -122.4167 http://www.eventbrite.ca/e/locationtech-meetup-sfo-tickets-10822501393 This evening event starts with a happy hour and features speakers building innovative solutions using open source and open data.
FedGeoDay D.C. washingtondc.jpg October 13, 2016 09:00:00 AM EST 38.895112 -77.036366 http://fedgeoday.org/2016/ This one day conference is for open source geo applications in the federal government.
London london.jpg November 23, 2016 6:00:00 PM GMT 51.5072 0.1275 https://www.meetup.com/London-Eclipse-User-Group/events/228434318/ Join us for an evening of collaboration, exchanging ideas and being inspired. Eclipse Converge is an event focussed on the collaborative working groups within the Eclipse open source community: • LocationTech • IoT • Science We will have a networking break in the middle of the evening, as well as food and beverages for those attending.
